alert.note: Alert for Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued August 09 at 3:15AM HST until August 09 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS CONTINUE UNTIL THIS EVENING FOR MOST MOUNTAIN AND LEEWARD AREAS... .The High Wind Warning was cancelled as we transition to more of a Wind Advisory level threat category. Wind speeds will continue to trend lower today and tomorrow as the high pressure center north of the islands and Hurricane Dora currently south of the state continue to move westward. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...East winds 20 to 35 mph with localized gusts around 50 mph. * WHERE...Windward Haleakala. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make it difficult to steer, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
